intro: Silene orientoalborzensis, commonly known as the Eastern Alborz silene, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Alborz range in Iran. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants known for their showy blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals and a distinctive central structure. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to biodiversity in its habitat.
